mal:requestIP.name: search
mal:requestIP.comment: Searches for products in the data distributor's archive

mal:field.name: root
mal:field.comment: Identifies the root for the search. E.g. /mission-x/attitude/ identifies the collection of attitude files for mission-x, and / indentifies the whole archive

mal:field.name: filter
mal:field.comment: Optional filter to be applied on the product metadata

mal:field.name: orderBy
mal:field.comment: Order the returned results by values in the metadata.

mal:field.name: limit
mal:field.comment: Limit the number of records returned by the get operation. If NULL, than the limit is automatically set by the provider. Any sensible implementation of an MDP provider should, anyway, provide a default limit.

mal:field.name: metadata
mal:field.comment: If True than return also the product metadata in addition to the product ID.

mal:response.comment: Returns the list of items that match the search

mal:submitIP.name: subscribe
mal:submitIP.comment: Subscribes to a product or collection of products given their product type. Like for the search, subscription-based product delivery, delivers only the product ID and, optionally, its metadata. It is up to the consumer to retrieve the actual data using the fetch operation

mal:field.name: metadata
mal:field.comment: If True, than include also the product metadata in the return message.

mal:submitIP.name: unsubscribe
mal:submitIP.comment: Unsubscribes from a previously subscribed product type or list of product types.

mal:invokeIP.name: fetch
mal:invokeIP.comment: Downloads the product data for a given product ID

mal:field.name: id
mal:field.comment: Identifier that univocally identifies one product item for a given provider

mal:requestIP.name: listTypes
mal:requestIP.comment: Lists product types offered by the provider. The consumer can provide an optional filter.

mal:field.name: root
mal:field.comment: Identifies the root for the search. E.g. /mission-x/attitude/ identifies the collection of attitude files for mission-x, and / indentifies the whole archive

mal:field.name: limit
mal:field.comment: Limit the number of records returned by the get operation. If NULL, than the limit is automatically set by the provider. Any sensible implementation of an MDP provider should, anyway, provide a default limit.

mal:response.comment: Returns the list of product types that match the search

mal:service.name: Management
mal:service.comment: Operations to manage the Products and the Product Types

mal:submitIP.name: add
mal:submitIP.comment: Adds a new Product to the product provider

mal:submitIP.name: update
mal:submitIP.comment: Updates an existing Product on the product provider. The Product is identified by its unique identifier

mal:submitIP.name: delete
mal:submitIP.comment: Deletes an existing Product from the product provider. The Product is identified by its unique identifier

mal:submitIP.name: addType
mal:submitIP.comment: Adds a new Product Type to the product provider

mal:submitIP.name: updateType
mal:submitIP.comment: Updates an existing Product Type on the product provider. The Product Type is identified by its unique identifier

mal:submitIP.name: deleteType
mal:submitIP.comment: Deletes an existing Product Type from the product provider. The Product Type is identified by its unique identifier

mal:composite.name: ItemId
mal:composite.comment: Path that univocally identifies one or more items (products or product types) offered by a provider. The path is local to the provider. As long as it is unique for a given provider, this field can take any valid path value as defined in RFC3986:relative-part, e.g. /mission-x/orbit/orbit_file_12345.xml to identify a specific file, or /mission-x/attitude/ to identify the collection of attitude files for mission-x

mal:composite.name: Item
mal:composite.comment: Identifies a product or product type, with an optional metadata

mal:item.comment: Sort in ascending order, from the lowest to the highest value
Sort in descending order, from the highest to the lowest value

mal:field.name: fieldName
mal:field.comment: The name of the field to use for sorting

mal:field.name: direction
mal:field.comment: The direction in which the sort the values for the fieldName
